intro.heading: Start with the fastest win
paragraphs: Most pubs don't need more ideas. They need one clear priority and a simple system that gets done while the pub stays busy.
I run The Anchor and built practical marketing systems that save time and drive footfall. If it doesn't work in a real pub, it doesn't go in the plan.
Message me what is hurting trade and I'll point you at the fastest win: local discovery, a midweek hook, better offers, or a tighter social system.

items.title: Fast diagnosis
items.description: We pinpoint what is actually causing the drop: visibility, offer, messaging, or execution.

items.title: 30-day action plan
items.description: A simple plan to stabilise trade and build momentum with weekly focus.

items.title: Templates and scripts
items.description: Ready-to-use messages, posts, and checklists so your team can implement quickly.

items.title: Google and local visibility
items.description: Fix the basics that stop customers choosing you: photos, reviews, categories, and posts.

items.title: Midweek systems
items.description: Repeatable hooks that turn dead nights into regulars.

items.title: Ongoing support (optional)
items.description: Stay hands-on or just get the plan - we decide what fits your time and budget.

steps.title: Message me

steps.title: Pick the win

steps.title: Implement fast

steps.title: Measure and adjust

faqs.question: Is this for pubs only?
faqs.answer: Yes for now. Everything here is built around pub trade and what works on the floor.

faqs.question: How quickly can you help?
faqs.answer: We can usually start with a quick chat straight away. The first wins can happen in days, with proper momentum building over 30 days.

faqs.question: Do you do it for me or show me how?
faqs.answer: Either. Some pubs want a simple plan and templates. Others want hands-on help. We'll choose what fits your time and budget.

faqs.question: How much does it cost?
faqs.answer: £75 per hour plus VAT. No packages and no long contracts.

faqs.question: Can you work remotely?
faqs.answer: Yes. Most work can be done remotely with your team: messaging, templates, content planning, offers, and training.
